title: Chem-barons have it fking rough
body: For one, they are viewed as criminal bosses by the Piltover police force, so that's {{champion:254}} and {{champion:51}} on them, although im sure those two already have their hands full.  But if any of the try to rise to power by creating connections to Piltover nobles, {{champion:164}} goes after them.  The citizens of Zaun mostly don't seem to have a very positive opinion about them, seeing as how {{champion:245}} was almost willing to choke one to death.  There' also {{champion:29}} and {{champion:36}} in Zaun, both of whom seem to kill indiscriminately.  {{champion:154}} is a crime fighting blob who im sure has interfered with Chem-barons on several occasions.  And most recently we've got {{champion:19}} and {{champion:6}} who are almost ENTIRELY DEDICATED to killing Chem-barons.  Considering the champs that have it out for Chem-barons, along with rival barons, I wouldn't expect Chem-barons to have especially long life spans.

{{champion:27}} : "Why am I so tanky despite being a "brain" guy? Well, long story short, the skin gets thicker every time it heals from wounds, it can also get more durable under stress, too."

The passive they were testing on the pbe fits him as a chembaron as well imo. A taller slender, pale man, that would easily slip through a crowd going mostly unnoticed by the public, however, the importance of the status of the man slipping by you doesn't sink in until he is talking to you face to face, and even then it a takes a moment for the shock to reel in, as you only upon analyzing him you spot his, crest sewn into the fabric of his coat.
His frail unnoticeable appearance stands to further solidify his theme as tank, in the lore you wouldn't notice it, but I'm sure despite his slender build ingame, no one would mistake Singed for a squishy (assuming he remains a tank whenever he is updated in the distant future).

Honestly if he remains the running type, I think he shouldn't be a tank. Why does he need to be both so fast you can't normally catch him and he's tanky enough that when you do catch him, it's hard to kill him?

Also, if Singed were a chem baron, that would put a damper on my theory that he augmented Urgot... who wants to kill chem barons. Though I guess he still could have done it.

He might he up an off tank, but I just can't imagine Singed being as squishy as a Talon or an ADC. 

But don't think the armor is the best way to convey this, like SEKAI said, a better explanation would the durability of his skin after all the experiments he probably ran on himself, the armor and the shield feel out off place for me.

What's a chem-baron? I have never found the answer to this question, could someone tell me?

They are the rulers of Zaun. There is nothing official about their status, but they have the money and the manpower, so that makes them the bosses. You could call them criminals, but that would imply Zaun actually has laws. So far, they all seem to be nasty individuals, but there's may be a few who are a bit better.

Saito Tekada is a notable chem-baron. 'Twas he who commissioned and funded the research into the strange lifeform that would become Zac. When Zac was rescued by his "parents", Tekada had them hunted down and murdered. Tekada has also hired Evelynn to assassinate a rival Baron, but he may have bitten off more than he can figuratively chew.

Another Baron of note is Marko Volkage. He had a master plan to expand his influence into Piltover, which would have made him one very influenctial individual. Camille promptly stopped this plan by stabbing him in the face.
